segments.text: I notice the sunlight streaming in through the window, illuminating the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It contrasts so starkly with the water spilling over the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is totally fixated on that plate, polishing it like the world around her doesn’t exist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it so strange that she doesn’t see the puddle forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something unsettling about how unaware she is of the risks around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is grasping for cookies at the top of his reach, and I feel my stomach drop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself holding my breath, hoping he doesn’t lose his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel excited for the kids, though; cookies are practically magical.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that thrill is mixed with dread, knowing how quickly it can turn sour.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout a warning, but I know it would ruin their fun.
segments.speaker: PAR
